comments.commentBody: Perhaps the US could offshore the hacking for better results.  Russia seems to be pretty darn good at it.  Trump could negotiate a deal as he apparently has some good connections.

We have 3 countries at present that have the ability to destroy the world as we know it. China, Russia and the US. Putin is a cunning and very intelligent bully. Trump is a blustering idiot bully. The world's future may rely on Jinping. This chess game has very serious consequences for the 99% of the human race that just wants to go about their business and live in peace and harmony. It will be fun to watch.

Actually we have more than 3, a nuclear exchange between India and Pakistan would likely be fatal for the rest of the world, Israel has the capability to initiate the Sampson Option should their survival be threatened, and if you look at the circles in this article North Korea might be gaining the same type of response and of course there is Iran where we pretty much have a hold on them as the article suggests and they are willing at least to come to the table.  It is in not only China's interest but also Russia, Japan, the far east countries, and the US to insist that North Korea come to the table now.  Right now North Korea is a pariah and if you ever looked at it from space at night you would notice one thing, North Korea is dark.  Wow what a market!!  So there might be a little wiggle room for negotiation, but we have to press it.  If we don't then it makes no sense for the government of North Korea to survive in it's present configuration and it's nuclear capabilities must be terminated.  Do we have the will for that?

Not yet our problem? Seriously? The fact that the mainland U.S. lies outside of North Korea's known strike zone doesn't change the fact that a nuclear attack somewhere like South Korea or Japan would almost certainly devastate the global economy, given the sheer number of goods emanating from the ASEAN region.

As a reminder, we entered World War II almost solely due to Japanese air attacks on an American base located 2,500 miles away from the mainland U.S. -- note that Hawaii didn't become a U.S. state until 18 years later -- as well as Guam and the Philippines, both of which were under U.S. control at the time.

Finally, the election of our admittedly incompetent president didn't change the fact that the U.S. likely has the finest intelligence community in the world. Indeed, the whole *point* of this article is that the Trump administration is largely on the same page as the Obama administration was with respect to the North Korean threat.

Stuxnet destroyed Iran's centrifuges, but Iran rebuilt. I agree that espionage actions like the computer viruses hurt both parties while engagement diplomatically works if given the time.

" Being bombed by air nonstop for weeks by the Strategic Air Command does have lasting consequences in behavior." If that were so, then how do you explain Vietnam? We bombed them for years and they still beat us while N. Korea probably has underground cities already prepared, so while I disagree with some of waht you said, I do agree that "Some times it almost appears that this is in fact the desired outcome that is being sought by the USA." Trump is putting a lot of money into the military and he wants a new navy which is absurd in the day of missiles like the one used on the USS Stark.

There is one huge difference: the failure rate of North Korea's Musudan missiles is 88%. That is 7 out of 8.

Consequently, even if successfully fired (which it has a 1 in 8 chance of), it would still have to get through an absolute plethora of ground-to-air and air-to-air missiles before it got even a small portion of the way to the US.

Other countries, namely Japan, and even China would be in much more danger.

Lacking much in the way of specifics regarding the North Korean missile launch, all I can tell you so far Is that Kim Jong-un is looking mighty sassy and contented these days and dressing much better than in the past. His current hat and overcoat are distinct improvements over Donald’s, which of course is not saying much. As for the haircut, while it still needs great improvement, I believe it is now on the verge of moving out of critical care, where it is currently rooming with Donald’s.

But for the fact that he still suffers terribly from bone spurs, President Trump and Steve Bannon would already be piloting the lead planes in our attack on North Korea. It’s times like these that I wish he could be our President forever.

Stanton’s Simple Solution: Disassemble some of those blockbuster bombs we never gave to Israel. Quietly move them to South Korea. Reassemble them there. Let it be known publicly that at the first sign of an another unfriendly act from Kim they will be dropped on his head.

Memo to Trump voters: Thanks very much for putting a nut job like Kim in charge of our country. Now we've got one of our own.
* Manafort: think he knows a lot about the Russian hacking.
Yes, Obama and his minions must be investigated immediatey and fully.
We all know different stuff.  PIAF was one of my few gimmes, and I hesitated to put in TREVI at first as I thought it too obvious for a Saturday

Hillary. Really? (As if we still really need to get the bottom of this Benghazi thing.). Hillary is gone, very gone. Only Trump is here and now, in power, spewing executive orders like a king, with a plate in front of his nose full of Russian borscht and bliny, and with far more serious subterfuge. Whether you liked the outcome or not, we are now all of us the victims of foreign government-sponsored spies and criminal computer hacking on a scale never before seen, with possible continuing blackmail by Russia. Hillary Clinton now has nothing to do with anything except getting clobbered in a rigged election. This is not going away.

Yes, it's true there is very much we don't know. However, here is what we DO know:

* The party platform of the GOP, a party long known for its hawkish stance on Russia, suddenly in 2016 was changed to bless the Russian take over of Crimea. This was done at the instigation of Trump's campaign.

* Trump's chief strategist has declared the "Judeo Christian West" must unify to fight Islam and win at any cost.

* We still have not seen Trump's tax returns, and so don't know the full extent of his business relationship with the Russian government and businesses. But we do have statements from the Trump family that such financial arrangements are extensive.

* US intelligence agencies have definitively stated that Russia interfered with the 2016 election, and the evidence indicates they did so at least against Ms. Clinton, if not actively for Trump.

So I ask you, how many needles have to point in the same direction before we call it north?

What is it going to take for everyone to see how suspicious Trump and associates activities are?  Schumer was in a public place with the public around him.  The meetings in question were in closed door settings with the President of the United States campaign associates, who then lied to cover them up and he aided and abetted their lying to the Vice President and the American people.  We still wouldn't been privy to these nefarious deeds, had the leaks not went to the press.  Aren't you at all concerned that a foreign power is controlling policy in your government and disrupting the democratic process?

It's not that they had meetings, it's that they LIED about them! It's the cover up, stupids. OK, those meetings are disgusting owing to the fact Russia was hacking US, but let's not get too far out in front of ourselves. I want to "hear" the "tapes."

Trump woke up spitting about Obama bugging Trump Tower, but I think that's just the power of Prism, myself. All of us send our electronic time, date, sender and receiver stamps to Utah, even this stupidness, you betcha. But I bet the contents are Russian characterizations of those conversations netted by the Five Eyes on their way back to Putin.

In his twits, Trump seems to say a judge turned down the first FISA order.  I can appreciate that judge might need more evidence before they agreed this Prism pull back was warranted.  Had Trump known, he'd have blown the cover to the Russians.

If all of the people in the Trump circle would simply come clean and talk about why they had so many Russian conversations, I daresay the "Russia bashing" would stop. The more we have to learn by leaks, the more we dig into the realities of Russian politics - that is not "bashing." This administration did all of this damage to themselves and they are continuing to do so by lying.
It's a witch hunt only when it plays against himself. Well, applying what he did to Hillary - i.e., basically destroy her -- what's good for the goose is good for the gander. Suck it up.

Re: Natick

http://rexwordpuzzle.blogspot.com/2008/07/sunday-jul-6-2008-brendan-emme...

Stand strong for more tax breaks for donors and millionaires?
You stand for nothing Mr. Walker...you have destroyed your state and the flagship universities by starving them.

This many is considered an enemy by most people in his state. These aren't the rich people. Big money, outside money keeps this jerk, undeucated and disliked, in office. Citizen's United got and keeps truly reviled politicians in office by "marketing" to the masses.

Governor Walker, where are the 250,000 JOBS you promised in 2009? Also, would you please stop scrubbing the page clean of references to the effects of global warming on our state's Department of Natural Resources site?? Gee, having second thoughts about cancelling a train between Milwaukee and Madison -- especially considering our states crumbling highways???

Excuse me Governor, but your Act 10 legislation was an ambush -- you never campaigned for the killing of unions, sir...Please don't pass that off as the truth. There are too many of us here in Wisconsin to fact check you.
Typical GOP hyperbole, conflating protest with death threats. That is what makes the GOP so dangerous. They are very skilled at propaganda.

"Explain that the centerpiece in the Republican agenda — returning authority to the states — is the best solution to our nation’s problems."

Isn't that rather like, " 'Shut up,' he explained"? He's stating, not explaining, and what he's stating is wrong. The smaller a group is, the more likely it is to go nuts (which is why all those little ethnic groups that want to be independent countries are mistaken in their wish).

Scott Walker’s take on life in Wisconsin is full of the stuff farmers spread on their fields.  Keeping money here to help the needy?  Then why does the Department of Public Education show that the number of homeless students across Wisconsin has doubled since he took office in 2008?  Life in Wisconsin has been a downward spiral and many of the comments above show that.  I now look with envy at my kids living in Minnesota where the Koch brothers do not yet own the governor.  Dan Behnke,
Says the guy who uses the tunnel system to get to and from his office so he doesn't have to face the public.
Scott says public sector unions have too much control over the government when in fact it's the NRA, dark money & republican beliefs that are going to ruin this country.
You've got that right!

And exactly how does this "power to the states" mantra work regarding the environment, as the administration prepares to choke us to death by rolling back auto emissions standards and denying California's waiver to enforce tougher protocols?  What hypocrisy here!
